other_tests.findings: Multiple tiny layering gallstones are demonstrated within the gallbladder. No evidence for intrahepatic biliary dilatation. A T2 bright nonenhancing focus is identified in segment II of the liver which may represent focal ectasia of the biliary tree or hepatic cysts. There is choledocholithiasis with a 3mm stone seen in the distal common bile duct without upstream biliary dilation. The pancreas enhances normally with no evidence for pathology. No pancreatic ductal dilatation, cyst, or mass. No free fluid. Two haemorrhagic cysts are identified in the kidneys, and bilateral perineural cysts are noted at the T10/T11 vertebral level.
